{{redirect|Dreamweaver|the song|Dream Weaver (song)|other uses|Dreamweaver (disambiguation)}} {{Multiple issues |primarysources=June 2011 |refimprove=March 2008 }} {{Infobox software | name = Adobe Dreamweaver | logo = [[Image:Adobe Dreamweaver CS5 Icon.png|64px|Adobe Dreamweaver CS5 Icon]] | screenshot = [[Image:Dreamweaver CS5 screenshot.png|300px|Adobe Dreamweaver CS5 Screenshot]] | caption = Adobe Dreamweaver CS5 under [[Windows 7]] | collapsible = | author = [[Macromedia]] | developer = [[Adobe Systems]] | released = | discontinued = | latest release version = 11.5 (CS5.5) | latest release date = {{release date|2011|04|12}} | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | frequently updated = | programming language = [[C++]] | operating system = [[Microsoft Windows]]
[[Mac OS X]] | platform = | size = | language = | status = | genre = [[Integrated development environment|IDE]] | license = Proprietary | website = {{URL|http://www.adobe.com/products/dreamweaver/}} }} [[File:Dreamweaver8.png|thumb|caption|Dreamweaver 8, the last version marketed by [[Macromedia]]]] '''Adobe Dreamweaver''' (formerly '''Macromedia Dreamweaver''') is a [[Proprietary software|proprietary]] [[web development]] [[application software|application]] originally created by [[Macromedia]], and is now developed by [[Adobe Systems]], which acquired Macromedia in 2005.{{cite web|title=Adobe Completes Acquisition of Macromedia|url=http://www.adobe.com/aboutadobe/pressroom/pressreleases/pdfs/200512/120505AdobeAcquiresMacromedia.pdf|work=Press Releases|publisher=Adobe, Inc.|accessdate=15 November 2011}} Dreamweaver is available for both [[Mac OS X|Mac]] and [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] [[operating system]]s. Recent versions have incorporated support for [[World Wide Web|web]] technologies such as [[Cascading Style Sheets|CSS]], [[JavaScript]], and various [[server-side scripting]] [[programming language|languages]] and [[Software framework|frameworks]] including [[Active Server Pages|ASP]] (ASP JavaScript, ASP VBScript, ASP.NET C#, ASP.NET VB), [[ColdFusion]], [[Scriptlet]], and [[PHP]].{{cite web|title=Learn to build dynamic websites and web applications|url=http://www.adobe.com/devnet/dreamweaver/application_development.html|work=Dreamweaver Developer Center|accessdate=15 November 2011}} == Features == Adobe Dreamweaver is a [[Proprietary software|proprietary]] web authoring [[application software|application]] that allows users to preview websites natively in a preview pane or in locally installed web browsers. It provides transfer and synchronization features, the ability to find and replace lines of text or code by search terms and regular expressions across the entire site, and a templating feature that allows single-source update of shared code and layout across entire sites without server-side includes or scripting. The behaviours panel also enables use of basic JavaScript without any coding knowledge, and integration with Adobe's Spry Ajax framework offers easy access to dynamically-generated content and interfaces. Dreamweaver can use third-party "Extensions" to extend core functionality of the application, which any web developer can write (largely in [[HTML]] and [[JavaScript]]). Dreamweaver is supported by a large community of extension developers who make extensions available (both commercial and free) for most web development tasks from simple rollover effects to full-featured shopping carts. Dreamweaver, like [[Comparison of WYSIWYG HTML editors#Editor features|other HTML editors]], edits [[files]] locally then uploads them to the remote web server using [[File Transfer Protocol|FTP]], [[SSH file transfer protocol|SFTP]], or [[WebDAV]]. Dreamweaver CS4 now supports the [[Subversion (software)|Subversion (SVN)]] version control system. === Syntax highlighting === As of version 5, Dreamweaver supports [[syntax highlighting]] for the following languages out of the box: * [[ActionScript]] * [[Active Server Pages]] (ASP). * [[ASP.NET]] (no longer supported as of version CS4 - http://kb2.adobe.com/cps/402/kb402489.html) * [[C Sharp (programming language)|C#]] * [[Cascading Style Sheets]] (CSS) * [[ColdFusion]] * [[EDML]] * [[Extensible HyperText Markup Language]] (XHTML) * [[Extensible Markup Language]] (XML) * [[Extensible Stylesheet Language Transformations]] (XSLT) * [[HTML|HyperText Markup Language]] (HTML) * [[Java (programming language)|Java]] * [[JavaScript]] * [[JavaServer Pages]] (JSP) (no longer supported as of version CS4 - http://kb2.adobe.com/cps/402/kb402489.html) * [[PHP: Hypertext Preprocessor]] (PHP) * [[Visual Basic]] (VB) * [[VBScript|Visual Basic Script Edition]] (VBScript) * [[Wireless Markup Language]] (WML) It is also possible for users to add their own language syntax highlighting. In addition, [[autocomplete|code completion]] is available for many of these languages. == Internationalization and localization == === Language availability === Adobe Dreamweaver CS5 is available in the following languages: Brazilian Portuguese, Chinese Simplified, Chinese Traditional, Czech, Dutch, English, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Polish, Russian, Spanish, Swedish, and Turkish.{{cite web |url=http://www.adobe.com/products/dreamweaver/systemreqs/ |title=Adobe Dreamweaver CS5: System Requirements and languages |accessdate=2011-01-29 |publisher=Adobe Systems Incorporated}} === Specific features for Arabic and Hebrew languages === The older Adobe Dreamweaver CS3 also features a Middle Eastern version that allows typing Arabic, Persian or Hebrew text (written from right to left) within the code view. Whether the text is fully Middle Eastern (written from right to left) or includes both English and Middle Eastern text (written left to right and right to left), it will be displayed properly in the browser. == Version history == {| class="wikitable" !
